intro: Lasiacis leptostachya, commonly known as the slender-stemmed lasia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in terminal spikes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
